definition: to run a red light/failing to stop at a red traffic light/(slang) to have sex with a girl while she is menstruating
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)

sentences.english: A city Laonongganzhao donkey, donkey Chuanghong Deng, fined 10 yuan.
sentences.chinese: 一老农赶著毛驴进城，驴闯红灯，罚10元。

sentences.english: The reason you have been stopped is that you just run a redlight .
sentences.chinese: 您被拦下的原因是，您刚刚闯红灯。

sentences.english: First, we can't red light, abide by traffic order.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我们不能闯红灯，恪守交通秩序。

sentences.english: How many people died or dying from some guys run red lights, who knows!
sentences.chinese: 那么有多少人死于闯红灯者的轮下呢？

sentences.english: The most flagrant scofflaw of them all is the red-light runner.
sentences.chinese: 最明目张胆的藐视法律行径要算闯红灯了。

sentences.english: The van comes to an abrupt stop to avoid committing the traffic lights.
sentences.chinese: 货车为了不闯红灯，来了个急停。

sentences.english: A rushing car knocked down a student who was running the red light .
sentences.chinese: 冲车撞倒一名学生被闯红灯的人。

sentences.english: You don't stop or look both ways before driving through a red light.
sentences.chinese: 闯红灯时既不停下来，也不东张西望。

sentences.english: A. Fine 20 yuan. B. Can you give me 20 yuan?C. Don't walk in the street again.
sentences.chinese: 新交通法规定，行人闯红灯可以被处以20元的罚款。

sentences.english: A teacher was given a ticket for driving through a red light.
sentences.chinese: 一名教师因为闯红灯被开罚单。

sentences.english: He shouldnt have broken the red light.
Anchor your ideas and don't run the redlight with others who are in "go slow" mode.
sentences.chinese: 抛出你的观点，别和走得慢的人一起闯红灯。

sentences.english: You’ll never see the drunk driver that’s about to run the red light.
sentences.chinese: 你永远不会希望碰到一个醉酒的司机闯红灯。

definition: to exceed the speed limit/to speed/high-speed
to break the rules/to violate regulations
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)
to show consideration for (others)/to yield to (another vehicle etc)/courtesy/comity
to push into a line out of turn/to cut in line/to queue-jump
